newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU confirms Irish, Greek green rates to devalue.
newsitem.headline: EU confirms Irish, Greek green rates to devalue.

text.p: The green rates of the Irish pound and the Greek drachma will be devalued with effect from Monday, the European Commission said.
It said on Friday that the green Irish pound would devalue to 0.759189 per Ecu from the current rate of 0.757666, while the green Greek drachma would devalue to 312.011 per Ecu from 311.858.

Earlier, the UK's Home Grown Cereals Authority (HGCA) forecast further devaluations after both countries averaged a negative monetary gap -- the difference between green and market rates -- during the May 16 to May 25 reference period.
Irish and Greek green rates were last devalued on May 16.
Green rates are used by the European Union to convert Ecus into the currencies of its member states in the Common Agricultural Policy.
